intro: Erodium jacquinianum var. bipinnatum, commonly known as the bipinnate erodium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with multiple pairs of leaflets, giving it a finely divided appearance. This variety is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture.
